metadata.title: Complete Genome Sequence of the Porcine Epidemic Diarrhea Virus Variant Tottori2/JPN/2014

abstract.original_text: Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PEDV) is a cause of diarrhea outbreaks at swine farms, causing vomiting, severe diarrhea, and mortality in piglets. We sequenced and analyzed the complete genome of recently isolated strains. Tottori2/JPN/2014, one of the sequenced PEDV strains, had a unique large deletion in the S gene.

sentences.segment_text: Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus ( PEDV ) is a cause of diarrhea outbreaks at swine farms ,
causing vomiting , severe diarrhea , and mortality in piglets .
We sequenced and analyzed the complete genome of recently isolated strains .
Tottori2/JPN/2014 , one of the sequenced PEDV strains ,
had a unique large deletion in the S gene .
